Thanks so much.  Sleepingin Seattle!

column2: Gary, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Raynauds: With a 30mg dose, it has made my Raynaud's less difficult this winter. My fingers still get cold, but stay red longer (they hurt) and if they do go white and numb, I can get them back to red more easily.

column2: wintercold, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This was prescribed to me to treat both hypertension and raynauds.  On the 60mg level I went from having an attack of raynaud's every day all winter to maybe once or twice during the season and extremely mild at that.  Because of the hypertension they raised the dose to 90mg, the 60mg made me feel tired, 90 made the tiredness worse and I get the ankle swelling if I don't exercise/keep hydrated and horrible constipation if I don't keep up on the fiber (never had a problem with that before), on the rare occassion I miss a dose by more than 5 hours get mild chest discomfort (also experienced with each dosage change- disconcerting, nothing major and it went away within a week or two).  The 90mg dose made no difference on the blood pressure, so talked the doctor into putting me back on the 60mg (most likely, they are going to get me on two blood pressure meds - not looking forward to it).  Overall, it works great on the Raynauds.  BP went from 170/110 to somewhere between 150/90 & 130/80 and staying steady in that range.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had some results with getting my Raynauds under control! I had to lower my mg from 60 to 30 cause for about 8 months it made me have psychological problems but so far it has been working well enough to help me with Raynauds! I'm still sleepy and have problems being socially active but I'm happy to feel a little warm again!
